samples.context: Reflex action is a special case of involuntary movement in voluntary organs. When a voluntary organ is in the vicinity of a sudden danger, it is immediately pulled away from the danger to save itself.
samples.question: What triggers a reflex action?

samples.context: For example; when your hand touches a very hot electric iron, you move away your hand in a jerk. All of this happens in flash and your hand is saved from the imminent injury.
samples.question: What happens when you touch a hot surface?

samples.context: This is an example of reflex action. Reflex actions occur quickly to prevent injury to the body.
samples.question: Why are reflex actions important?
